DataElement.preferredName: Cognitive Impairment Diagnosis Informed Consent Ability Clinical Trial Patient Compliance Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions related to the presence of diminished mental function, the quality of being able to perform informed consent, and the extent to which a patient conforms to studies that test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cognitive Impairment Diagnosis Informed Consent Ability Clinical Trial Patient Compliance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Diminished mental function._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._The extent to which a patient conforms to medical advice regarding prescribed regimen, lifestyle, dietary changes, follow-up schedule and other recommendations.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Diminished mental function.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredName: Informed Consent Ability Clinical Trial Patient Compliance
Property.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:The extent to which a patient conforms to medical advice regarding prescribed regimen, lifestyle, dietary changes, follow-up schedule and other recommendations.

Concepts.definition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The extent to which a patient conforms to medical advice regarding prescribed regimen, lifestyle, dietary changes, follow-up schedule and other recommendations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have mental impa
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have mental impairment that may compromise the ability to give informed consent and comply with the requirements of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cognitive or other impairment that would prevent compliance with study requirements?
